thread.title: Boost for Liverpool as Can returns to training ahead of final

title: Boost for Liverpool as Can returns to training ahead of final
text:
May 21, 2018 / 12:55 PM / Updated an hour ago Boost for Liverpool as Can returns to training ahead of final Simon Evans 1 Min Read
LIVERPOOL, England (Reuters) - Liverpool’s German international midfielder Emre Can, who has missed the past two months with injury, returned to training ahead of Saturday’s Champions League final against Real Madrid. FILE PHOTO: Soccer Football - Premier League - Liverpool vs Watford - Anfield, Liverpool, Britain - March 17, 2018 Liverpool's Emre Can with Liverpool manager Juergen Klopp as he goes off injured REUTERS/Phil Noble
Can trained with the Liverpool squad on Monday and his return to fitness is a boost for Klopp whose midfield options have been restricted by injury to Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain.
But Klopp cautioned about Can’s potential involvement in the game in Kiev.
“It depends always on the reaction. But let me put it this way, 10 days ago I didn’t think it is possible he could do what he did today. It looked good. It was really positive but we have to wait,” he told reporters.
“The door is open - he is really desperate to be a part. We shall see,” Klopp added.
James Milner, who missed the final Premier League game of the season against Brighton & Hove Albion with a muscle problem, also took part in the training session. Reporting by Simon Evans, editing by Ed Osmond
